question: Will NASA record 2023 as the hottest year on record (1.03°C or higher)?

recent_temperature_trends.2020: 1.02°C above the 20th-century average, tying with 2016 as the hottest year on record (as of early 2022 data)
recent_temperature_trends.2021: Preliminary data suggests it was among the top seven hottest years on record

conclusion: While the prediction that 2023 will be the hottest year on record involves uncertainties, the data points and analysis suggest that, given the existing trends and potential for an El Niño event, there is a significant possibility that global temperatures could reach or exceed 1.03°C above the 20th-century average.
